resources.string: Johns Creek FBLA is a nationally recognized chapter with over 20 students who compete nationally annually. Come compete with us to the top.
FBLA is co-curricular with Career Tech and Engineering (CTAE) courses. This means that course info is the most up to date as possible.
Johns Creek FBLA is a proud supporter of March of Dimes and more non-profit organizations. We believe helping our community is a vital part of business.
Johns Creek FBLA takes what students learn and making it a reality by taking them on field trips and more about business.

The Business Achievement Awards (BAA’s) is a program that enriches students’ leadership skills. The four levels are Future, Business, Leader, and America. Students can go through the levels by focusing on activities.
The Career and Membership Achievement Program (CMAP) is a program where students can develop their job skills. The three levels of CMAP are Directive, Executive, and President.
